title: Liberty School 2013 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Turned earth, coffee grounds, asphalt and dried cherries show on the mushroomy nose of this widely available bottling. Black tea and strong coffee flavors emerge through a thick veil of chunky tannins.

title: :Nota Bene 2012 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is 100% Cabernet Franc coming from Dineen (75%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyards. Barnyard, cherry, pencil box and spice aromas are followed by lightly styled game, dried cherry and medicine cabinet flavors.

title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Dolmo Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Leather, raw wood and berry aromas start off this young wine. The palate is fairly raw and gripping, while herbal, peppery blackberry flavors finish with a toasty oak note and tannic rub.

title: Retorno 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Spunky, edgy, slightly cheesy cherry and plum aromas come in front of a palate with crisp acidity and firm tannins. Tart plum and pie cherry flavors finish with scraping acidity and a touch of sourness.

title: Tousey 2014 Riesling (Hudson River Region)
description: Brisk and light-footed, there's a delicacy and restraint to tart grapefruit and honeydew flavors in this off-dry Riesling. It's not a deeply concentrated or complex wine, but offers thirst quenching refreshment. Drink now.

title: Borsao 2014 Quadrum Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of cherry Kool-Aid and fruit punch offer a sprinkle of spice in the background. This is simple in feel, with citrusy acidity. The red-fruit flavors are easy going and the finish is mild.

title: Domaine Alban Roblin 2014  Sancerre
description: Soft and gently fruity, this immediately attractive wine has plenty of acidity that points up the apple and green plum fruits and final freshness. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Cordaillat 2014 Rosé (Reuilly)
description: Made from Pinot Gris, this pale colored wine has just a blush of rosé. It is so fresh and perfumed, only lightly textured. A fine apéritif style, the wine has juicy red currant flavors, topped with orange zest. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Villargeau 2014 Les Genêts Gris Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: This is an herbal, cool wine. Concentrated citrus flavors percolate through the wine to give freshness and bright acidity. It's light, very crisp and ready to drink.

title: Maison des 3 Ponts 2014 Maison des 3 Ponts Chardonnay (Charentais)
description: From the Cognac region, this ripe, totally fruity wine has no suggestion of wood aging. Attractive apple and light citrus flavors are ripe and right up front. Acidity adds freshness to the end. Drink now.

title: Matteo 2011 Red Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This Merlot-centric wine brings aromas of herbs, soy and dried raisins, seeminlyg a bit past it prime. The flavors are lightly and the tannins seem dried out. Drink now.

title: Joseph Mellot 2014 Le Rabault  (Sancerre)
description: A balanced, ripe wine, this offers a good contrast between the dusty tannins and bright red-berry fruits. It's ready to drink with its fruitiness, although it will develop a richer, fuller character as it ages over the next year. Drink from 2017.

title: Louis Chevallier 2013  Bourgogne
description: This is soft, rounded and light. Baked apples and a creamy texture come with a refreshing burst of acidity tempered by a lightly toasty character. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas Organic Tempranillo (Spain)
description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are simple as pie, while this feels a touch astringent and drawing. Tart but fresh plum and raspberry flavors are slightly briny. Juicy and satisfactory on the finish.

title: Nebla 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Clear and lucid to the eye, this Verdejo shows pine, grapefruit, orange and apple aromas along with oily pith. The mouthfeel is more plump and wet than defined, while lychee and melon flavors are offset by tolerable bitter pyrazines and grapefruit flavors.

title: François Montand NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)
description: Based in the Jura, this producer blends grapes from other regions to make this fresh, crisp and apple-flavored wine. It's light, bright and just off dry, with attractive acidity. Like it's rosé partner, it is really for apéritifs.

title: Frisson Wines 2013 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Muted aromatics tease on the nose before chewy texture and full-bodied weight enter the scene. Deceptively light and airy at first, the wine then delves into a hearty taste of marzipan and oak.

title: Gustafson Family 2012 Watchtower Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Intense ripeness opens this wine, followed by a rustic note of leather and horsehide. Puckering tannins show off the oak before a glimpse of blackberry and black currant fight for existence.

title: Henry Fessy 2014 Sous la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: All tangy fruit, this wine was fermented in stainless steel to keep the freshness of the fruit. It is crisp and lively, full of apple and pink-grapefruit flavors with a clean, bright aftertaste. Drink from mid-2016.

title: Consilience 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light and shy on the nose, this wine with patience shows pomegranate punch and rain-slicked slate. The palate offers tart cranberry, a touch of Earl Grey tea and pencil-lead flavors.

title: De Fina 2012 Reverence Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the coolish appellation of Coombsville, this wine offers industrial-strength tannin around herbal cedar, tar and currant, the finish strongly ripe and full bodied.

title: Bitner 2012 Reserve Late Harvest Riesling
description: Aromas of pear, red apple and pineapple lead to sweet green and red apple flavors with a tart finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Crucillón Garnacha-Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: Briny, wiry red-fruit aromas are mild but saucy. This blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo feels ordinary, while flavors of briny plum are fresh but limited. A finish with a healthy pulse is fine for what this is.

title: Bota Box 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Soft and fresh, this medium-bodied wine has clean, neutral flavors and is easy to sip. Aromas are a little peachy while flavors suggest pears. The texture is mild.

title: Otazu 2014 Rosado Merlot (Navarra)
description: This Merlot-based rosé smells cheesy and not all that fruity. Chunky and obtuse on the palate, this tastes of generic citrus and berry fruits. An adequate finish is par for the course.

title: Trailhead 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon is softened by 19% Merlot, providing a sanguine experience marred by ponderously huge tannins that make the fruit almost impenetrable. Once pierced, expect currant, cedar and leather.

title: François Montand NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)
description: The Grenache and Cinsault in this rosé are from the Jura and other vineyards. The result is a soft, smooth and creamy wine. Fresh red-berry fruits give it a round, almost off-dry character. It's fresh at the end, and definitely in an apéritif style.

title: Foundry 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is dull and diluted in nebulous black fruit and a medium-sized body, with plenty of supportive tannins. The finish is quick.

title: Amizade 2011 Godello (Monterrei)
description: Stalky, bitter aromas of peach pit and white pepper dust announce a dilute palate with bitter flavors of citrus pith and stone-fruit pits along with oxidized notes. This is tired on the finish and seemingly past its prime.

title: Bodegas Langa 2013 Pieza el Coll Red (Calatayud)
description: The nose on this blend of Grenache, Carignan and other grapes burns and smells of iodine, mushroom, olive and rustic berry fruits. High acidity and an obtuse mouthfeel house salty, briny, minerally plum flavors, while the finish runs low on fruit.
